column2: Underlying asset that backs each HydroCoin
column3: 1 aqua credit (e.g. 1 m³ of desalinated water) + micro‑stake in CurrenSea Bank™ reserves
column4: Each HydroCoin is redeemable for a measurable quantity of desalinated water and a proportional share of the treasury, ensuring intrinsic value.

column2: Maximum supply or dynamic supply rule
column3: Floating; supply scales with desalination output and water reserves
column4: Minting is tied to real‑time water production.  Supply expands or contracts based on available reserves and redemption activity, rather than a fixed cap.

column2: Proportion of circulating supply held in CurrenSea Bank™ reserves
column4: A high reserve ratio provides liquidity and stability.  Half of all HydroCoins issued remain in reserve to meet redemption and maintain peg.

column2: Desired turnover of each coin per year
column4: Velocity indicates economic activity.  A target of 12 implies each HydroCoin changes hands about once per month.  Higher velocity can signal healthy circulation.

column3: PoseiNet™ smart contracts mint/burn tokens according to water output and demand
column4: Mint/burn logic is encoded in audited contracts; supply adjustments are transparent and tamper‑proof.

column3: Guardian payroll; AbyssWalk™ migration incentives; ENFT relic sales; HydroCard issuance
column4: These channels seed HydroCoins into the economy.  Every distribution event logs metadata on chain for traceability.

column2: Payment card for civilians and Guardians
column3: HydroCard = wallet + identity credential for AbyssWalk™ participants
column4: HydroCard denominated in HydroCoin allows everyday purchases, transfers, and access to reserves via CurrenSea Bank™.

column2: Major holders and users of HydroCoin
column3: Guardians, civilians, enterprises, CurrenSea Bank™, PoseiNet™ nodes
column4: All stakeholders interact via the same ledger.  Guardians use HydroCoin for operations; civilians use it for daily trade and savings.

column2: Rule describing supply expansion and contraction
column4: Supply grows with net water output and shrinks when coins are redeemed for water or treasury shares.  Conversion rate determines how many coins are minted per unit of water.

column3: Bleu‑Seal watermark on each coin; adoption under Overscale Law
column4: HydroCoins carry visible and invisible seals to ensure every clone or derivative loops back value to the origin vault.  Licensing rights embedded in the token prevent theft and dilution.
